title: Hero Xpulse 421 concept sketch showcased at ECIMA 2024
description: The Xpulse 421 appears to have a fresh design language and looks like a larger version of the Xpulse 210. The concept’s design sketches showcase a striking front end, a large windscreen, and protective handguards, suggesting the motorcycle will have a more rugged and off-road friendly design.  Will be equipped with a TFT Similar design language as the Xpulse 210 Hero Xpulse 421 concept details Just like the Xpulse 210, the Xpulse 421 will be equipped with a TFT display which will have a similar set of features. Hero hasn’t released any information about the engine or specifications. However, it's safe to assume it will be a retuned version of the same engine found in the Mavrick 440 which is equipped with a 440cc single-cylinder engine that produces 27hp at 6,000rpm and 36Nm at 4,000rpm. As of now there is no concrete date to when Hero plans to launch the Xpulse 421. Upon launch the Xpulse 421 will have to rival the likes of the Royal Enfield Himalayan 450 and the upcoming KTM 390 Adventure.   Image source   Also see: Hero Xpulse 210 revealed at EICMA 2024
author: Autocar India News Desk
excerpt: Hero MotoCorp has unveiled a concept sketch of its highly anticipated Xpulse 421 concept at the EICMA 2024.

html:
Hero MotoCorp has unveiled a concept sketch of its highly anticipated Xpulse 421 concept at the EICMA 2024.

The Xpulse 421 appears to have a fresh design language and looks like a larger version of the Xpulse 210. The concept’s design sketches showcase a striking front end, a large windscreen, and protective handguards, suggesting the motorcycle will have a more rugged and off-road friendly design. 

  1. Will be equipped with a TFT
  2. Similar design language as the Xpulse 210

Hero Xpulse 421 concept details

Just like the Xpulse 210, the Xpulse 421 will be equipped with a TFT display which will have a similar set of features. Hero hasn’t released any information about the engine or specifications. However, it's safe to assume it will be a retuned version of the same engine found in the Mavrick 440 which is equipped with a 440cc single-cylinder engine that produces 27hp at 6,000rpm and 36Nm at 4,000rpm. As of now there is no concrete date to when Hero plans to launch the Xpulse 421. Upon launch the Xpulse 421 will have to rival the likes of the Royal Enfield Himalayan 450 and the upcoming KTM 390 Adventure.

  • Videos
